title: Fix deprecated system attribute in flake.nix overlay
description:
## Problem

The vibetree flake.nix is using the deprecated `final.system` attribute in the overlay definition, which causes a warning when used by downstream projects:

```
evaluation warning: 'system' has been renamed to/replaced by 'stdenv.hostPlatform.system'
```

## Location

**File:** flake.nix
**Section:** overlays.default (line ~50)

## Current Code

```nix
overlays.default = final: prev: {
  vibetree = self.packages.${final.system}.default;
};
```

## Required Fix

Change to use the new non-deprecated attribute:

```nix
overlays.default = final: prev: {
  vibetree = self.packages.${final.stdenv.hostPlatform.system}.default;
};
```

## Context

Nix has deprecated the short `system` attribute in favor of the more explicit `stdenv.hostPlatform.system` path. This change maintains the same functionality while following current Nix best practices.

## Testing

After the fix:
1. Build should work without warnings: `nix build`
2. The overlay should still provide the vibetree package for all supported systems (x86_64-linux, aarch64-linux, x86_64-darwin, aarch64-darwin)
3. Verify with: `nix flake check`
4. Test in a downstream project to ensure no warnings appear

title: Finish beads initialization and onboarding
description:
## Overview

Complete the beads setup that was started. The repository has beads initialized with prefix `vibetree` but needs to finish onboarding and documentation setup.

## Tasks

### 1. Standardize Agent Instructions

Move any Claude-specific instructions to `AGENTS.md` (the industry standard):
- Check if `CLAUDE.md` exists in the repo
- If it exists, rename it to `AGENTS.md`
- Create a symlink: `ln -s AGENTS.md CLAUDE.md` for backwards compatibility
- If neither exists, create `AGENTS.md` as a new file

### 2. Run Beads Onboarding

Execute the onboarding command and follow its instructions:

```bash
bd onboard
```

This will:
- Provide content to add to AGENTS.md about beads workflow
- Give instructions for updating CLAUDE.md (if present)
- Provide important reminders about beads usage

Follow all the instructions provided by the onboarding command.

### 3. Commit Beads Files

After onboarding is complete, commit the beads initialization files:

```bash
git add .beads/
git add AGENTS.md CLAUDE.md  # if applicable
git commit -m "Initialize beads issue tracker with prefix vibetree"
```

## Context

- Beads was initialized with prefix: `vibetree`
- Database: `.beads/beads.db`
- Git hooks and merge driver already configured
- The assistant repo has this repo configured as an additional repo for cross-repo issue visibility

## Success Criteria

- [ ] AGENTS.md exists with beads documentation
- [ ] CLAUDE.md symlink exists (if applicable)
- [ ] `bd onboard` instructions completed
- [ ] All beads files committed to git
- [ ] Can run `bd list` and see issues
